import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())

    for i in range(n):
        line = sys.stdin.readline()
        line = line.strip()
        line = line.split()

        # Get out the relevant data
        direction = line[0]
        minutes = int(line[1])
        time = line[2] + ":" + line[3]

        # Split the time into hours and minutes
        time = time.split(":")
        hours = int(time[0])
        minutes = int(time[1])

        # Roll the clock forward or backward
        if direction == "F":
            minutes += minutes
        else:
            minutes -= minutes

        # Get the current hour and minute
        if minutes >= 60:
            hours += 1
            minutes -= 60
        elif minutes < 0:
            hours -= 1
            minutes += 60

        # Get the current hour and minute
        if hours >= 24:
            hours -= 24
        elif hours < 0:
            hours += 24

        # Print the new time
        print(str(hours) + " " + str(minutes))

main()
